ipGlobalsBOOTPRelayStatus.name: ipGlobalsBOOTPRelayStatus
ipGlobalsBOOTPRelayStatus.description: Whenever to activate the BOOTP Relay protocol on the device. enable - set by the user, means activate the BOOTP Relay protocol over the defined VLANs. disable - set by the user, means don't active the BOOTP Relay protocol. backup - set by the user, means the BOOTP Relay protocol is in stand-by. It will enter to activeBackup mode after IP REDUNDANCY mechanism will enter to active mode. activeBackup - set by the device (status), means the backup BOOTP Relay is working (after time-out of IP REDUNDANCY).

ipGlobalsICMPErrMsgEnable.name: ipGlobalsICMPErrMsgEnable
ipGlobalsICMPErrMsgEnable.description: Whenever to send ICMP messages such as Destination Unreachable, etc.

ipGlobalsARPInactiveTimeout.name: ipGlobalsARPInactiveTimeout
ipGlobalsARPInactiveTimeout.description: Time-out required to remove inactive ARP entries. The value is in seconds. The default value is 4 hours

ipInterfaceTable.name: ipInterfaceTable
ipInterfaceTable.description: This table is an extention of MIB II IpAddrTable, and is used to add/delete entries to/from that table. In addition it contains private objects.

ipInterfaceEntry.name: ipInterfaceEntry
ipInterfaceEntry.description: The information concerning one of this entity's IP interfaces. An IP interface is a logical connection to a certain IP net/subnet.

ipInterfaceAddr.name: ipInterfaceAddr
ipInterfaceAddr.description: The IP address to which this entry's addressing information pertains.

ipInterfaceNetMask.name: ipInterfaceNetMask
ipInterfaceNetMask.description: The subnet mask associated with the IP address of this entry. The value of the mask is an IP address with all the network bits set to 1 and all the hosts bits set to 0.

ipInterfaceLowerIfAlias.name: ipInterfaceLowerIfAlias
ipInterfaceLowerIfAlias.description: This object is an 'alias' name for the lower-layer interface on top of which this IP interface is defined. The alias is specified by the network manager, and provides a non-volatile 'handle' for the lower-layer interface. The semantics of the object are similar to the semantics of the ifAlias object, defined by the Interfaces MIB. At the time when this Madge MIB object was defined, the latest release of the Interfaces MIB was draft-ietf-ifmib-mib-05.txt. The purpose is to support all methods (static or dynamic) for creation of interfaces and to allow creation of IP table entries without the need of the layer 2 interface to be present on the device at the time of the creation. It is assumed that some implementation dependent mechanisms allow the IP application to be informed about the creation of new lower layer interfaces.

ipInterfaceType.name: ipInterfaceType
ipInterfaceType.description: The logical type of the interface. The default depends on the physical type. For example Ethernet and Token-Ring LANs are of type broadcast

ipInterfaceForwardIpBroadcast.name: ipInterfaceForwardIpBroadcast
ipInterfaceForwardIpBroadcast.description: Whether the router forwards IP directed broadcasts that are to be transmitted as link-layer broadcast to an attached net or subnet.

ipInterfaceBroadcastAddr.name: ipInterfaceBroadcastAddr
ipInterfaceBroadcastAddr.description: The value of the least-significant bit in the IP broadcast address used for sending datagrams on the (logical) interface associated with the IP address of this entry. For example, when the Internet standard all-ones broadcast address is used, the value will be 1. This value applies to both the subnet and network broadcasts addresses used by the entity on this (logical) interface.

ipInterfaceProxyArp.name: ipInterfaceProxyArp
ipInterfaceProxyArp.description: When proxy ARP is enabled, the router responds to ARP requests received on one link-layer interface for an IP-address that is reachable via another link-layer interface. The response provides the router's own MAC address.

ipInterfaceStatus.name: ipInterfaceStatus
ipInterfaceStatus.description: For adding and deleting IP interfaces. Deleting this row means deleting the corresponding entry in IpAddrTable (MIB II). Deleting an IP interface also causes deletion of all static routes defined on this IP interface, as well as protocol interfaces (e.g. RIP and OSPF) defined on this IP interface.

ipInterfaceMainRouterAddr.name: ipInterfaceMainRouterAddr
ipInterfaceMainRouterAddr.description: The IP address of the main router backed up on this interface.

ipInterfaceARPServerStatus.name: ipInterfaceARPServerStatus
ipInterfaceARPServerStatus.description: Whenever to activate the ARP Server mechanism on this interface. enable - set by the user, means activate the ARP Server mechanism over this IP interface. disable - set by the user, means don't active the ARP Server mechanism over this IP interface.

ipInterfaceName.name: ipInterfaceName
ipInterfaceName.description: The name of this interface for compatibility with cli.

ipInterfaceNetbiosRebroadcast.name: ipInterfaceNetbiosRebroadcast
ipInterfaceNetbiosRebroadcast.description: inbound - netbios received from the interface are rebarodcasted, outbound - netbios are rebraodcasted to this interface, both - netbios are rebroadacsted both from and to this interface, disable - netbios is not rebraodcasted neither from nor to this interface. Currently only both and disable are supported

ipInterfaceIcmpRedirects.name: ipInterfaceIcmpRedirects
ipInterfaceIcmpRedirects.description: enable - enable the sending of redirect messages if the router is forced to re-send a packet through the same interface on which it was received. disable - disable the sending of redirect messages on this interface.

ripGlobalsRIPEnable.name: ripGlobalsRIPEnable
ripGlobalsRIPEnable.description: Whenever to activate the RIP protocol on the device. disable means don't activate RIP over all the IP interfaces enable means that the status of each interface is relevant

ripGlobalsLeakOSPFIntoRIP.name: ripGlobalsLeakOSPFIntoRIP
ripGlobalsLeakOSPFIntoRIP.description: Whenever to leak (redistribute) routes learned from OSPF protocol into the domain of the RIP protocol.

ripGlobalsLeakStaticIntoRIP.name: ripGlobalsLeakStaticIntoRIP
ripGlobalsLeakStaticIntoRIP.description: Whenever to leak (redistribute) routes learned from Static Route into the domain of the RIP protocol.

ripInterfaceTable.name: ripInterfaceTable
ripInterfaceTable.description: This table is an extention of rip2IfConfTable, and is used to add/delete objects entries to/from that table.

ripInterfaceEntry.name: ripInterfaceEntry
ripInterfaceEntry.description: The information concerning one of this entity's IP interfaces. An IP interface is a logical connection to a certain IP net/subnet.

ripInterfaceAddr.name: ripInterfaceAddr
ripInterfaceAddr.description: The IP address to which this entry's addressing information pertains.

ripInterfaceMetric.name: ripInterfaceMetric
ripInterfaceMetric.description: This variable indicates the number of hops that is to be assign to that interface.

ripInterfaceSplitHorizon.name: ripInterfaceSplitHorizon
ripInterfaceSplitHorizon.description: Whether to activate Poison Reverse algorithm, Split Horizon or none of them, on this interface

ripInterfaceAcceptDefaultRoute.name: ripInterfaceAcceptDefaultRoute
ripInterfaceAcceptDefaultRoute.description: Whether to accept the default route from receive RIP message.

ripInterfaceSendDefaultRoute.name: ripInterfaceSendDefaultRoute
ripInterfaceSendDefaultRoute.description: Whether to send the default route in RIP message.

ripInterfaceState.name: ripInterfaceState
ripInterfaceState.description: The operational (current state) of the IP interface from RIP point of view. It depends on Global RIP status, IP interface status and rip interface STATUS. inactive - set by the device (status), the rip is not active on this interface. active - set by the device (status), rip is active on this interface.

ripInterfaceSendMode.name: ripInterfaceSendMode
ripInterfaceSendMode.description: What the router sends on this interface. All - send the whole routing table according to the RIP version. DefaultOnly - send default route only. DoNotDend - don't send any RIP information on this interface.

ripInterfaceVersion.name: ripInterfaceVersion
ripInterfaceVersion.description: What RIP information the router sends on this interface.

ospfGlobalsLeakRIPIntoOSPF.name: ospfGlobalsLeakRIPIntoOSPF
ospfGlobalsLeakRIPIntoOSPF.description: Whenever to leak (redistribute) routes learned from RIP protocol into the domain of the OSPF protocol.

ospfGlobalsLeakStaticIntoOSPF.name: ospfGlobalsLeakStaticIntoOSPF
ospfGlobalsLeakStaticIntoOSPF.description: Whenever to leak (redistribute) routes learned from Static Route into the domain of the OSPF protocol.

ospfGlobalsLeakDirectIntoOSPF.name: ospfGlobalsLeakDirectIntoOSPF
ospfGlobalsLeakDirectIntoOSPF.description: Whenever to leak (redistribute) routes learned from Direct into the domain of the OSPF protocol.

relayTable.name: relayTable
relayTable.description: This table is an extention of vlConfTable, and is used to add/delete DHCP Servers to/from that table.

relayEntry.name: relayEntry
relayEntry.description: The information concerning one of this entity's VLAN interfaces. An VLAN interface is a virtual connection to a switch.

relayVlIndex.name: relayVlIndex
relayVlIndex.description: A unique value for each interface. Its value ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The value for each interface must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of the entity's network management system to the next re-initialization.

relayVlPrimaryServerAddr.name: relayVlPrimaryServerAddr
relayVlPrimaryServerAddr.description: The IP address of the primary server, to which the BOOTP/DHCP requests to be sent.

relayVlSeconderyServerAddr.name: relayVlSeconderyServerAddr
relayVlSeconderyServerAddr.description: The IP address of the secondary server, to which the BOOTP/DHCP requests to be sent.

relayVlStatus.name: relayVlStatus
relayVlStatus.description: For deleting an DHCP/BOOTP servers entry. The entry will be deleted upon deleting the corresponding VLAN

relayVlRelayAddr.name: relayVlRelayAddr
relayVlRelayAddr.description: The IP address of the Relay, i.e. the router's IP address to write in the relayed request (giaddr field in the Bootp packet). When there are multiple IP interfaces on the same VLAN such that the router has multiple IP addresses on the VLAN, the user can configure which of these addresses to use when relaying requests arriving on this VLAN. This relay address is used by the server to determines the subnet from which the address shall be allocated. The special value 255.255.255.255 means DUPLICATE. In this case the Relay will duplicate each request arriving on this VLAN and send to the server multiple copies of the request, a copy for each of the router's IP addresses on that VLAN. The relay address in each copy of the request shall be the router's IP address (NOT 255.255.255.255). The special value 0.0.0.0 means that the router shall use the Default value (lowest IP address on the VLAN) for the relay address

ipAccessControlEnable.name: ipAccessControlEnable
ipAccessControlEnable.description: Whenever to activate the IP ACCESS CONTROL statements on the device. disable means don't activate IP ACCESS CONTROL over all the IP statements enable means activate IP ACCESS CONTROL over all the IP statements

ipAccessControlTable.name: ipAccessControlTable
ipAccessControlTable.description: This table is used to add/delete access control statement to/from that table.

ipAccessControlEntry.name: ipAccessControlEntry
ipAccessControlEntry.description: The information concerning one of this entity's IP interfaces. An IP interface is a logical connection to a certain IP net/subnet.

ipAccessControlSrcAddr.name: ipAccessControlSrcAddr
ipAccessControlSrcAddr.description: The IP address of the source address.

ipAccessControlSrcMask.name: ipAccessControlSrcMask
ipAccessControlSrcMask.description: The MASK address of the source address.

ipAccessControlDstAddr.name: ipAccessControlDstAddr
ipAccessControlDstAddr.description: The IP address of the destination address.

ipAccessControlDstMask.name: ipAccessControlDstMask
ipAccessControlDstMask.description: The MASK address of the destination address.

ipAccessControlOperation.name: ipAccessControlOperation
ipAccessControlOperation.description: How to operate the IP ACCESS CONTROL statement, on the receiving packet. Forwards the packet, Block (Discard) the packet or block (Discard) the packet and report to the user by sending trap.

ipAccessControlActivation.name: ipAccessControlActivation
ipAccessControlActivation.description: Does the IP ACCESS CONTROL statement done by HW or SW(CPU). HW - wire-speed, SW - regular.

ipAccessControlProtocol.name: ipAccessControlProtocol
ipAccessControlProtocol.description: Over which protocol does the IP ACCESS CONTROL statement activate. Icmp, Tcp, Udp. None - means IP addresses only

ipAccessControlApplication.name: ipAccessControlApplication
ipAccessControlApplication.description: Over which application does the IP ACCESS CONTROL statement activate. The exception are: above1023 can work over TCP or UDP, none can't work over TCP or UDP or ICMP only none is excepted

ipAccessControlStatus.name: ipAccessControlStatus
ipAccessControlStatus.description: For create/delete of a IP ACCESS CONTROL statement.

ipRedundancyStatus.name: ipRedundancyStatus
ipRedundancyStatus.description: Whenever to activate the IP REDUNDANCY mechanism on the device. enable - set by the user, means activate the IP REDUNDANCY mechanism over the defined IP interfaces. disable - set by the user, means don't active the IP REDUNDANCY mechanism over the defined IP interfaces. inactive - set by the device (status), means the backup interface is in stand-by (after enable operation). active - set by the device (status), means the backup interface is working (after time-out).

ipRedundancyTimeout.name: ipRedundancyTimeout
ipRedundancyTimeout.description: Time-out required to activate the backup process of IP REDUNDANCY. After Time-out the Redundant router assumes that the main (Backuped) router is not operational, and takes control over all defined IP interfaces of the main. The value is in seconds. The default value is 12

ipRedundancyPollingInterval.name: ipRedundancyPollingInterval
ipRedundancyPollingInterval.description: The polling interval used to poll the Main (Backed up) router. The value is multiply of ipRedundancyTimeout. The value is in seconds. The default value is 3

ipShortcutARPServerStatus.name: ipShortcutARPServerStatus
ipShortcutARPServerStatus.description: Whenever to activate the ARP Server mechanism on the device. enable - set by the user, means activate the ARP Server mechanism over the defined IP interfaces. disable - set by the user, means don't active the ARP Server mechanism over the defined IP interfaces.

ipMulticastInterfaceTable.name: ipMulticastInterfaceTable
ipMulticastInterfaceTable.description: This table is used to update multicast parameters over interfaces already define

ipMulticastInterfaceEntry.name: ipMulticastInterfaceEntry
ipMulticastInterfaceEntry.description: The information concerning one of this entity's interfaces.

ipMulticastInterfaceIfIndex.name: ipMulticastInterfaceIfIndex
ipMulticastInterfaceIfIndex.description: A unique value for each interface. Its value ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The value for each interface must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of the entity's network management system to the next re-initialization.

ipMulticastInterfaceSendAll.name: ipMulticastInterfaceSendAll
ipMulticastInterfaceSendAll.description: The user will be able to configure whenever to send the all Multicast packets to this interface. Enable - Enable the user to define this interface, over all the existing groups Disable - Will acts according to the other parameters.

ipMulticastInterfaceState.name: ipMulticastInterfaceState
ipMulticastInterfaceState.description: The current state (operational) of the IP Multicast from IP Multicast point of view. It depends on global ipMRouteEnable status and Multicast interface status. Inactive - set by the device (status), Global IP multicast is disabled or Multicast is disable on this interface. Active - set by the device (status), Global IP multicast is enable and Multicast is active on this interface.

ipMulticastInterfaceStatus.name: ipMulticastInterfaceStatus
ipMulticastInterfaceStatus.description: For enable/disable of a IP multicast over an interface.

ipEZ2RControlBoostedRoutersTimeout.name: ipEZ2RControlBoostedRoutersTimeout
ipEZ2RControlBoostedRoutersTimeout.description: Set the timeout of EZ2route routers

ipEZ2RControlHostsTimeout.name: ipEZ2RControlHostsTimeout
ipEZ2RControlHostsTimeout.description: Set the timeout of EZ2route hosts

ipxCircTable.name: ipxCircTable
ipxCircTable.description: This table is an extention of Novell mib IpxCircTable, and is used to add/delete entries to/from that table. In addition it contains private objects.

ipxCircEntry.name: ipxCircEntry
ipxCircEntry.description: The information concerning one of this entity's IPX circuits. An IPX circuit is a logical connection to a certain IPX netNumber.

ipxCircIndex.name: ipxCircIndex
ipxCircIndex.description: The identifier of this circuit, unique within the instance of IPX. This value may be written only when creating a new entry in the table.

ipxCircNetNumber.name: ipxCircNetNumber
ipxCircNetNumber.description: The IPX network number of this circuit.

ipxCircLowerIfAlias.name: ipxCircLowerIfAlias
ipxCircLowerIfAlias.description: This object is an 'alias' name for the lower-layer interface on top of which this IP interface is defined. The alias is specified by the network manager, and provides a non-volatile 'handle' for the lower-layer interface. The semantics of the object are similar to the semantics of the ifAlias object, defined by the Interfaces MIB. At the time when this Madge MIB object was defined, the latest release of the Interfaces MIB was draft-ietf-ifmib-mib-05.txt. The purpose is to support all methods (static or dynamic) for creation of interfaces and to allow creation of IPX table entries without the need of the layer 2 interface to be present on the device at the time of the creation. It is assumed that some implementation dependent mechanisms allow the IPX application to be informed about the creation of new lower layer interfaces.

ipxCircEncapsulation.name: ipxCircEncapsulation
ipxCircEncapsulation.description: The media type (encapsulation of layer2) of this circuit.

ipxCircStatus.name: ipxCircStatus
ipxCircStatus.description: For adding and deleting Circuits. Deleting this row means deleting the corresponding entry in ipxCircTable. Deleting a Circuit also causes deletion of all static routes defined on this Circuit, as well as protocol Circuit (e.g. RIP and SAP) defined on this Circuit.

ipxCircRipUpdate.name: ipxCircRipUpdate
ipxCircRipUpdate.description: The RIP periodic update interval, in seconds.

ipxCircRipAgeMultiplier.name: ipxCircRipAgeMultiplier
ipxCircRipAgeMultiplier.description: The holding multiplier for information received in RIP periodic updates.

ipxCircRipStatus.name: ipxCircRipStatus
ipxCircRipStatus.description: Indicates whether RIP information may be sent/received over this circuit. Set by the user

ipxCircSapUpdate.name: ipxCircSapUpdate
ipxCircSapUpdate.description: The SAP periodic update interval, in seconds.

ipxCircSapAgeMultiplier.name: ipxCircSapAgeMultiplier
ipxCircSapAgeMultiplier.description: The holding multiplier for information received in SAP periodic updates.

ipxCircGetNearestServerReply.name: ipxCircGetNearestServerReply
ipxCircGetNearestServerReply.description: Indicates whether to respond to SAP get nearest server requests received on this circuit.

ipxCircSapStatus.name: ipxCircSapStatus
ipxCircSapStatus.description: Indicates whether SAP information may be sent/received over this circuit.

ipxCircRipState.name: ipxCircRipState
ipxCircRipState.description: Indicates whether RIP information may be sent/received over this circuit. Set by the device to reflect the RIP status and the interface status

ipxCircSapState.name: ipxCircSapState
ipxCircSapState.description: Indicates whether SAP information may be sent/received over this circuit. Set by the device to reflect the SAP status and the interface status

ipxDestTable.name: ipxDestTable
ipxDestTable.description: This table replace the Novell mib IpxDestTable, and is used to add/delete entries to/from that table.

ipxDestEntry.name: ipxDestEntry
ipxDestEntry.description: The information concerning one of this entity's IPX Routes. An IPX service is a logical connection to a certain IPX Server.

ipxDestNetNum.name: ipxDestNetNum
ipxDestNetNum.description: The IPX network number portion of the IPX address of the destination.

ipxDestProtocol.name: ipxDestProtocol
ipxDestProtocol.description: The routing protocol from which knowledge of this destination was obtained.

ipxDestTicks.name: ipxDestTicks
ipxDestTicks.description: The delay in ticks to reach this destination.

ipxDestHopCount.name: ipxDestHopCount
ipxDestHopCount.description: The number of hops necessary to reach the destination.

ipxDestNextHopCircIndex.name: ipxDestNextHopCircIndex
ipxDestNextHopCircIndex.description: The unique identifier of the circuit, used to reach the next hop.

ipxDestNextHopNICAddress.name: ipxDestNextHopNICAddress
ipxDestNextHopNICAddress.description: The NIC address of the next hop.

ipxDestNextHopNetNum.name: ipxDestNextHopNetNum
ipxDestNextHopNetNum.description: The IPX network number of the next hop.

ipxDestAge.name: ipxDestAge
ipxDestAge.description: The age of the Routing table entry.

ipxServTable.name: ipxServTable
ipxServTable.description: This table replace the Novell mib IpxServTable, and is used to add/delete entries to/from that table.

ipxServEntry.name: ipxServEntry
ipxServEntry.description: The information concerning one of this entity's IPX Services. An IPX service is a logical connection to a certain IPX Server.

ipxServProtocol.name: ipxServProtocol
ipxServProtocol.description: The protocol from which knowledge of this service was obtained.

ipxServNetNum.name: ipxServNetNum
ipxServNetNum.description: The IPX network number portion of the IPX address of the service.

ipxServNode.name: ipxServNode
ipxServNode.description: The node portion of the IPX address of the service.

ipxServSocket.name: ipxServSocket
ipxServSocket.description: The socket portion of the IPX address of the service.

ipxServHopCount.name: ipxServHopCount
ipxServHopCount.description: The number of hops to the service.

ipxServAge.name: ipxServAge
ipxServAge.description: The age of the SAP entry.

ipxAccessControlEnable.name: ipxAccessControlEnable
ipxAccessControlEnable.description: Whenever to activate the IPX ACCESS CONTROL statements on the device. disable means don't activate IPX ACCESS CONTROL over all the IPX statements enable means activate IPX ACCESS CONTROL over all the IPX statements

ipxAccessControlTable.name: ipxAccessControlTable
ipxAccessControlTable.description: This table is used to add/delete IPX access control statement to/from that table.

ipxAccessControlEntry.name: ipxAccessControlEntry
ipxAccessControlEntry.description: The information concerning one of this entity's IPX access control statements.

ipxAccessControlSrcAddr.name: ipxAccessControlSrcAddr
ipxAccessControlSrcAddr.description: The IPX network of the source address.

ipxAccessControlDstAddr.name: ipxAccessControlDstAddr
ipxAccessControlDstAddr.description: The IPX network of the destination address.

ipxAccessControlOperation.name: ipxAccessControlOperation
ipxAccessControlOperation.description: How to operate the IPX ACCESS CONTROL statement, on the receiving packet. Forwards the packet, Block (Discard) the packet or block (Discard) the packet and report to the user by sending trap.

ipxAccessControlActivation.name: ipxAccessControlActivation
ipxAccessControlActivation.description: Does the IPX ACCESS CONTROL statement done by HW or SW(CPU). HW - wire-speed, SW - regular.

ipxAccessControlStatus.name: ipxAccessControlStatus
ipxAccessControlStatus.description: For create/delete of an IPX ACCESS CONTROL statement.

ipxSapFilterEnable.name: ipxSapFilterEnable
ipxSapFilterEnable.description: Whenever to activate the IPX SAP Filters statements on the device. disable means don't activate IPX SAP Filters over all the IPX SAP statements enable means activate IPX SAP Filter over all the IPX SAP statements

ipxSapFilterTable.name: ipxSapFilterTable
ipxSapFilterTable.description: Table of input/output SAP filter according to IPX circuit number.

ipxSapFilterEntry.name: ipxSapFilterEntry
ipxSapFilterEntry.description: An entry in the SAP filter table

ipxSapFilterCircIndex.name: ipxSapFilterCircIndex
ipxSapFilterCircIndex.description: .... -- 0xffff means this is a global SAP filter

ipxSapFilterServiceNetNumber.name: ipxSapFilterServiceNetNumber
ipxSapFilterServiceNetNumber.description: Number network of the filtered service. Value 0xFFFFFFFF applies for any network. DEFVAL {0xFFFFFFFF}

ipxSapFilterServiceType.name: ipxSapFilterServiceType
ipxSapFilterServiceType.description: The type of the service which may be filtered; value 0xFFFF applies for all types of service and it's default DEFVAL {0xFFFF}

ipxSapFilterServerName.name: ipxSapFilterServerName
ipxSapFilterServerName.description: The name of the service which may be filtered; wildcards (*) may be used in the end of the name. DEFVAL {*}

vlConfTable.name: vlConfTable
vlConfTable.description: This table is an extention of MIB II ifTable, and is used to add/delete entries to/from that table. In addition it contains private objects.

vlConfEntry.name: vlConfEntry
vlConfEntry.description: The information concerning one of this entity's VLAN interfaces. An VLAN interface is a virtual connection to a switch.

vlConfIndex.name: vlConfIndex
vlConfIndex.description: A unique value for each interface. Its value ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The value for each interface must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of the entity's network management system to the next re-initialization.

vlConfAlias.name: vlConfAlias
vlConfAlias.description: This object is an 'alias' name for the lower-layer interface on top of which this IP interface is defined. The alias is specified by the network manager, and provides a non-volatile 'handle' for the lower-layer interface. The semantics of the object are similar to the semantics of the ifAlias object, defined by the Interfaces MIB. At the time when this Madge MIB object was defined, the latest release of the Interfaces MIB was draft-ietf-ifmib-mib-05.txt. The purpose is to support all methods (static or dynamic) for creation of interfaces and to allow creation of IP table entries without the need of the layer 2 interface to be present on the device at the time of the creation. It is assumed that some implementation dependent mechanisms allow the IP application to be informed about the creation of new lower layer interfaces.

vlConfStatus.name: vlConfStatus
vlConfStatus.description: For adding and deleting VLAN interfaces. Deleting this row means deleting the corresponding entry in ifTable (MIB II). Deleting a VLAN interface is allowed only if IP interface is not defined on this VLAN.

vlBridgeTable.name: vlBridgeTable
vlBridgeTable.description: For each Bridge segment an entry of this table specifies a set of VLANs, which it contains.

vlBridgeEntry.name: vlBridgeEntry
vlBridgeEntry.description: A entry of this table specifies a Group of VLANs and VLANs belonging to it

vlBridgeProtocol.name: vlBridgeProtocol
vlBridgeProtocol.description: The protocol, supported by this VLAN. The meanings of the values are: other: none of the following. This VLAN includes any protocol except the following protocols. It is a bridging VLAN. L2 relies on a third-party router to exchange traffic between nodes on different VLANs of this type. dec : This is a bridging VLAN, L2 relies on a third-party router to exchange traffic between nodes on different DEC VALNs of this type. netBios: This is a Bridging VLAN, L2 relies on a third-party router to exchange traffic between nodes on different NetBIOS VLAN of this type. appleTalk: This is a Bridging VLAN, L2 relies on a third-party router to exchange traffic between nodes on different appleTalk VLAN of this type. value of other(1) always exist

vlBridgeGroupIndex.name: vlBridgeGroupIndex
vlBridgeGroupIndex.description: A logical number, corresponded this group of VLANs

vlBridgeIndex.name: vlBridgeIndex
vlBridgeIndex.description: A logical number, corresponded this VLAN. Each VLAN is allowed to participate in ONE group only

vlBridgeStatus.name: vlBridgeStatus
vlBridgeStatus.description: It is used to create or delete an entry

layer2GlobalsBridgeEnable.name: layer2GlobalsBridgeEnable
layer2GlobalsBridgeEnable.description: Whenever to activate the Bridge capability on the device. enable - set by the user, means activate the Bridge capability over the defined VLANs. disable - set by the user, means don't active the Bridge capability. backup - set by the user, means the Bridge capability is in stand-by. It will enter to activeBackup mode after IP REDUNDANCY mechanism will enter to active mode. activeBackup - set by the device (status), means the backup Bridge is working (after time-out of IP REDUNDANCY).

routeGroupRouteMode.name: routeGroupRouteMode
routeGroupRouteMode.description: A bit mask representing the routing mode of the module: bit 0 - L2 switching bit 1 - EZ2Route bit 2 - Router bit 3 - Rich L2 bit 4 - WebSwitch (Load balance, application redirection). Currently, the following values for this bit mask are defined: secondLayer(1) - no routing. Behaves like P333T. ez2route (3) - no configuration is needed. Boosts external routers router (5) - Behaves like third layer switch. routerAndWebSwitch(21) - Perform routing and Load-Balancing or application redirection

drVlConfTable.name: drVlConfTable
drVlConfTable.description: This table is an extention of MIB II ifTable, and is used to add/delete entries to/from that table. In addition it contains private objects.

drVlConfEntry.name: drVlConfEntry
drVlConfEntry.description: The information concerning one of this entity's VLAN interfaces. An VLAN interface is a virtual connection to a switch.

drVlConfSlot.name: drVlConfSlot
drVlConfSlot.description: The slot number of the module

drVlConfIndex.name: drVlConfIndex
drVlConfIndex.description: A unique value for each interface. Its value ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The value for each interface must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of the entity's network management system to the next re-initialization.

drVlConfAlias.name: drVlConfAlias
drVlConfAlias.description: This object is an 'alias' name for the lower-layer interface on top of which this IP interface is defined. The alias is specified by the network manager, and provides a non-volatile 'handle' for the lower-layer interface. The semantics of the object are similar to the semantics of the ifAlias object, defined by the Interfaces MIB. At the time when this Madge MIB object was defined, the latest release of the Interfaces MIB was draft-ietf-ifmib-mib-05.txt. The purpose is to support all methods (static or dynamic) for creation of interfaces and to allow creation of IP table entries without the need of the layer 2 interface to be present on the device at the time of the creation. It is assumed that some implementation dependent mechanisms allow the IP application to be informed about the creation of new lower layer interfaces.

drVlConfStatus.name: drVlConfStatus
drVlConfStatus.description: For adding and deleting VLAN interfaces. Deleting this row means deleting the corresponding entry in ifTable (MIB II). Deleting a VLAN interface is allowed only if IP interface is not defined on this VLAN.

drIpInterfaceTable.name: drIpInterfaceTable
drIpInterfaceTable.description: This table is an extention of MIB II IpAddrTable, and is used to add/delete entries to/from that table. In addition it contains private objects.

drIpInterfaceEntry.name: drIpInterfaceEntry
drIpInterfaceEntry.description: The information concerning one of this entity's IP interfaces. An IP interface is a logical connection to a certain IP net/subnet.

drIpInterfaceSlot.name: drIpInterfaceSlot
drIpInterfaceSlot.description: The slot number of the module

drIpInterfaceAddr.name: drIpInterfaceAddr
drIpInterfaceAddr.description: The IP address to which this entry's addressing information pertains.

drIpInterfaceNetMask.name: drIpInterfaceNetMask
drIpInterfaceNetMask.description: The subnet mask associated with the IP address of this entry. The value of the mask is an IP address with all the network bits set to 1 and all the hosts bits set to 0.

drIpInterfaceLowerIfAlias.name: drIpInterfaceLowerIfAlias
drIpInterfaceLowerIfAlias.description: This object is an 'alias' name for the lower-layer interface on top of which this IP interface is defined. The alias is specified by the network manager, and provides a non-volatile 'handle' for the lower-layer interface. The semantics of the object are similar to the semantics of the ifAlias object, defined by the Interfaces MIB. At the time when this Madge MIB object was defined, the latest release of the Interfaces MIB was draft-ietf-ifmib-mib-05.txt. The purpose is to support all methods (static or dynamic) for creation of interfaces and to allow creation of IP table entries without the need of the layer 2 interface to be present on the device at the time of the creation. It is assumed that some implementation dependent mechanisms allow the IP application to be informed about the creation of new lower layer interfaces.

drIpInterfaceType.name: drIpInterfaceType
drIpInterfaceType.description: The logical type of the interface. The default depends on the physical type. For example Ethernet and Token-Ring LANs are of type broadcast

drIpInterfaceForwardIpBroadcast.name: drIpInterfaceForwardIpBroadcast
drIpInterfaceForwardIpBroadcast.description: Whether the router forwards IP directed broadcasts that are to be transmitted as link-layer broadcast to an attached net or subnet.

drIpInterfaceBroadcastAddr.name: drIpInterfaceBroadcastAddr
drIpInterfaceBroadcastAddr.description: The value of the least-significant bit in the IP broadcast address used for sending datagrams on the (logical) interface associated with the IP address of this entry. For example, when the Internet standard all-ones broadcast address is used, the value will be 1. This value applies to both the subnet and network broadcasts addresses used by the entity on this (logical) interface.

drIpInterfaceProxyArp.name: drIpInterfaceProxyArp
drIpInterfaceProxyArp.description: When proxy ARP is enabled, the router responds to ARP requests received on one link-layer interface for an IP-address that is reachable via another link-layer interface. The response provides the router's own MAC address.

drIpInterfaceStatus.name: drIpInterfaceStatus
drIpInterfaceStatus.description: For adding and deleting IP interfaces. Deleting this row means deleting the corresponding entry in IpAddrTable (MIB II). Deleting an IP interface also causes deletion of all static routes defined on this IP interface, as well as protocol interfaces (e.g. RIP and OSPF) defined on this IP interface.

drIpInterfaceMainRouterAddr.name: drIpInterfaceMainRouterAddr
drIpInterfaceMainRouterAddr.description: The IP address of the main router backed up on this interface.

drIpInterfaceARPServerStatus.name: drIpInterfaceARPServerStatus
drIpInterfaceARPServerStatus.description: Whenever to activate the ARP Server mechanism on this interface. enable - set by the user, means activate the ARP Server mechanism over this IP interface. disable - set by the user, means don't active the ARP Server mechanism over this IP interface.

drIpInterfaceName.name: drIpInterfaceName
drIpInterfaceName.description: The name of this interface for compatibility with cli.

drIpInterfaceNetbiosRebroadcast.name: drIpInterfaceNetbiosRebroadcast
drIpInterfaceNetbiosRebroadcast.description: inbound - netbios received from the interface are rebarodcasted, outbound - netbios are rebraodcasted to this interface, both - netbios are rebroadacsted both from and to this interface, disable - netbios is not rebraodcasted neither from nor to this interface. Currently only both and disable are supported

drIpInterfaceIcmpRedirects.name: drIpInterfaceIcmpRedirects
drIpInterfaceIcmpRedirects.description: enable - enable the sending of redirect messages if the router is forced to re-send a packet through the same interface on which it was received. disable - disable the sending of redirect messages on this interface.

drStaticCidrTable.name: drStaticCidrTable
drStaticCidrTable.description: The static route table for this entity. The table includes all static routes, both active and inactive. Note that inactive static routes are deleted from RFC2096 ipCidrRouteTable; Hence the need for this private table to maintain user configuration about disabled routes. The table also includes the EntID index, to allow for use in a distributed environment.

drStaticCidrEntry.name: drStaticCidrEntry
drStaticCidrEntry.description: A particular route to a particular destina- tion, under a particular policy.

drStaticCidrEntID.name: drStaticCidrEntID
drStaticCidrEntID.description: The Id of the entity for which a set of rows applies. This index is provided as a mean of distributing non-related information on different entities such as physical modules. The value: The module ID (slot number).

drStaticCidrDest.name: drStaticCidrDest
drStaticCidrDest.description: Equivalent to ipCidrRouteDest. The destination IP address of this route. This object may not take a Multicast (Class D) address value. Any assignment (implicit or otherwise) of an instance of this object to a value x must be rejected if the bitwise logical-AND of x with the value of the corresponding instance of the drStaticCidrMask object is not equal to x.

drStaticCidrMask.name: drStaticCidrMask
drStaticCidrMask.description: Equivalent to ipCidrRouteMask. Indicate the mask to be logical-ANDed with the destination address before being compared to the value in the drStaticCidrDest field. For those systems that do not support arbitrary subnet masks, an agent constructs the value of the drStaticCidrMask by reference to the IP Ad- dress Class. Any assignment (implicit or otherwise) of an instance of this object to a value x must be rejected if the bitwise logical-AND of x with the value of the corresponding instance of the drStaticCidrDest object is not equal to drStaticCidr- Dest.

drStaticCidrTos.name: drStaticCidrTos
drStaticCidrTos.description: Equivalent to ipCidrRouteTos. The policy specifier is the IP TOS Field. The encoding of IP TOS is as specified by the following convention. Zero indicates the default path if no more specific policy applies. +-----+-----+-----+-----+-----+-----+-----+-----+ | | | | | PRECEDENCE | TYPE OF SERVICE | 0 | | | | | +-----+-----+-----+-----+-----+-----+-----+-----+ IP TOS IP TOS Field Policy Field Policy Contents Code Contents Code 0 0 0 0 ==> 0 0 0 0 1 ==> 2 0 0 1 0 ==> 4 0 0 1 1 ==> 6 0 1 0 0 ==> 8 0 1 0 1 ==> 10 0 1 1 0 ==> 12 0 1 1 1 ==> 14 1 0 0 0 ==> 16 1 0 0 1 ==> 18 1 0 1 0 ==> 20 1 0 1 1 ==> 22 1 1 0 0 ==> 24 1 1 0 1 ==> 26 1 1 1 0 ==> 28 1 1 1 1 ==> 30

drStaticCidrNextHop.name: drStaticCidrNextHop
drStaticCidrNextHop.description: Equivalent to ipCidrRouteNextHop. On remote routes, the address of the next sys- tem en route; Otherwise, 0.0.0.0.

drStaticCidrIfIndex.name: drStaticCidrIfIndex
drStaticCidrIfIndex.description: Equivalent to ipCidrRouteIfIndex. The ifIndex value which identifies the local interface through which the next hop of this route should be reached.

drStaticCidrType.name: drStaticCidrType
drStaticCidrType.description: Equivalent to ipCidrRouteType. The type of route. Note that local(3) refers to a route for which the next hop is the final destination; remote(4) refers to a route for which the next hop is not the final destina- tion. reject (2) refers to a route which, if matched, discards the message as unreachable. This is used in some protocols as a means of correctly aggregating routes.

drStaticCidrMetric1.name: drStaticCidrMetric1
drStaticCidrMetric1.description: Equivalent to ipCidrRouteMetric1. The primary routing metric for this route. The semantics of this metric are determined by the routing-protocol specified in the route's drStaticCidrProto value. If this metric is not used, its value should be set to -1.

drStaticCidrPrecedence.name: drStaticCidrPrecedence
drStaticCidrPrecedence.description: Equivalent to ipCidrRouteMetric5 (our use of it). The precedence of this routing rule, compared to other routes which may have been learned vie other methods. Translates into ipCidrRouteMetric5 in ipCidrRouteTable (RFC2096). Higher values mean lower precedence. The Agent initialize this value as follows: 0 - drStaticCidrCRPType of bridgingFWLB or routingFWLB 250 - drStaticCidrCRPType of regularStatic

drStaticCidrCRPType.name: drStaticCidrCRPType
drStaticCidrCRPType.description: The internal type of this static routing entry. routingFWLB - Route to a group of routing Firewallse bridgingFWLB - Route through a group of bridging Firewalls regularStatic - Regular static routes

drStaticCidrOperStatus.name: drStaticCidrOperStatus
drStaticCidrOperStatus.description: The operational status of this route. up - the route is active, and is present in ipCidrRouteTable. down - the route is inactive; it is not present in ipCidrRouteTable.

drStaticCidrName.name: drStaticCidrName
drStaticCidrName.description: A label given to this route by the user. Has no equivalent in ipCidrRouteTable.

drStaticOwner.name: drStaticOwner
drStaticOwner.description: The user who is responsible for the entry. Management Apps should write: 'user on host' CLI should write:CLI_User on local device

drStaticCidrStatus.name: drStaticCidrStatus
drStaticCidrStatus.description: Creation, activation, de-activation and deletion of a static route, using the RowStatus convention: active(1), notInService(2) ,notReady(3), createAndGo(4), createAndWait(5), destroy(6). when an entry is placed in the notInService state, the corresponding route is disabled (removed from ipCidrRouteTable)
